channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump Administration heightens fraud charges against Minnesota, pauses day care funds
item.description: The Trump administration says its stopping federal funds to Minnesota because of fraud. The day cares and the state are fighting back.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration says its stopping federal funds to Minnesota because of fraud. The day cares and the state are fighting back.
item.dc:creator: Dana Ferguson

item.title: Trump says brighter days are ahead for American farmers
item.description: President Trump says 2026 will be better for American farmers, thanks in part to $12 billion in new federal "bridge payments." But do farmers share that optimism?
item.content:encoded: President Trump says 2026 will be better for American farmers, thanks in part to $12 billion in new federal "bridge payments." But do farmers share that optimism?
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: Do you deserve the right to repair what you own?
item.description: We find out more about the movement afoot to be able to fix things you own — it's called "right to repair."
item.content:encoded: We find out more about the movement afoot to be able to fix things you own — it's called "right to repair."
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: After a limited release of Epstein files leaves many unsatisfied, what's next?
item.description: The Justice Department is facing pushback from lawmakers and the public for its failure to release all of its files on the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
item.content:encoded: The Justice Department is facing pushback from lawmakers and the public for its failure to release all of its files on the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: What life in Harney County looks like 10 years after the Malheur occupation
item.description: A decade after the 40-day armed occupation of a federally owned wildlife refuge in Oregon, locals reflect on the occupiers' failed attempt to end federal land ownership.
item.content:encoded: A decade after the 40-day armed occupation of a federally owned wildlife refuge in Oregon, locals reflect on the occupiers' failed attempt to end federal land ownership.
item.dc:creator: Conrad Wilson

item.title: George Clooney gets French citizenship — and another dust-up with Trump
item.description: The French government says it granted George and Amal Clooney citizenship because of their contributions to its international influence. Their family has primarily lived in France since 2021.
item.content:encoded:
The French government says it granted George and Amal Clooney citizenship because of their contributions to its international influence. Their family has primarily lived in France since 2021.

(Image credit: Henry Nicholls)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Somali day care centers face threats. And, how Trump could save Obamacare subsidies
item.description: Somali-run daycare centers in Minnesota report receiving threats following a viral video that accused them of fraud. And, how Trump could play a role in extending ACA subsidies.
item.content:encoded:
Somali-run daycare centers in Minnesota report receiving threats following a viral video that accused them of fraud. And, how Trump could play a role in extending ACA subsidies.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: U.S. interventions in Latin America and the Caribbean haven't always gone as planned
item.description: President Trump's pressure campaign against Venezuela is the latest in a long saga of U.S. intervention in the region that is rooted in the 1823 Monroe Doctrine — and is a mix of success and failure.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's pressure campaign against Venezuela is the latest in a long saga of U.S. intervention in the region that is rooted in the 1823 Monroe Doctrine — and is a mix of success and failure.

(Image credit: Miguel Vinas)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: AI data centers use a lot of electricity. How it could affect your power bill
item.description: AI data centers require incredible amounts of energy to run. NPR's Planet Money investigates how that demand for power might affect your electric bills.
item.content:encoded: AI data centers require incredible amounts of energy to run. NPR's Planet Money investigates how that demand for power might affect your electric bills.
item.dc:creator: Keith Romer

item.title: Right-wing influencer's fraud claim leads to threats for Somali day care owners
item.description: A right-wing media influencer accused Somali day care operators in Minnesota of defrauding the federal government. This has led to threats against staff and a federal child care funding freeze.
item.content:encoded: A right-wing media influencer accused Somali day care operators in Minnesota of defrauding the federal government. This has led to threats against staff and a federal child care funding freeze.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann
